docs.snippet: BALTIMORE, Feb. 4 A Federal Court jury here found Walter Weikers, 67 years old, of Baltimore, guilty today of jury tampering in the aborted trial of Gov. Marvin Mandel of Maryland. He faces a possible maximum penalty of five years in jail and/or a...
docs.lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE, Feb. 4 A Federal Court jury here found Walter Weikers, 67 years old, of Baltimore, guilty today of jury tampering in the aborted trial of Gov. Marvin Mandel of Maryland. He faces a possible maximum penalty of five years in jail and/or a $5,000 fine.
docs.abstract: Fed ct jury, Baltimore, finds Walter Weikers guilty of jury tampering in aborted Mandel trial (S)

headline.main: Baltimore Man Guilty Of Jury Tampering

docs.snippet: SAN ANTONIO, Feb. 2 It used to take only two hours for Ted Castillo to make enough money to pay his monthly home utility bill. Now it takes two days....
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN ANTONIO, Feb. 2 It used to take only two hours for Ted Castillo to make enough money to pay his monthly home utility bill. Now it takes two days.
docs.abstract: Article on soc and econ impact on San Antonio and other Tex cities of rising cost of intrastate gas; San Antonio was protected from rising costs until curtailments of supplies led Tex RR Comm to permit Lo-Vaca Gathering to break long-term contract under which city paid 24c per thousand cu ft of gas; now pays $1.97 and will pay $2.20 by next fall (M)

headline.main: Gas Crisis Came Early to Texans And Lingers On; Gas Crisis Felt 5 Years Ago in Texas, a Producing State Exempt from Price Controls

docs.snippet: IT'S MOSTLY UNKNOWN, undistinguished and unremembered, the short stretch of Manhattan that lies along Broadway and the Ave-  nue of the Americas between 23d and 33d Streets, yet it was once at the heart of New York life, its Great White Way and it...
docs.lead_paragraph: IT'S MOSTLY UNKNOWN, undistinguished and unremembered, the short stretch of Manhattan that lies along Broadway and the Ave- nue of the Americas between 23d and 33d Streets, yet it was once at the heart of New York life, its Great White Way and its Tin Pan Alley. It's a noname section that spills over into Chelsea and Madison Square Park on the south and abuts Herald Square on the north.
docs.abstract: Travel article on Broadway and 6th Av between 23d and 33d Sts; illus (M)

docs.snippet: BALTIMORE, Feb. 2 The lawyer for Walter Weikers, accused of trying to bribe a juror in the trial of Gov. Marvin Mandel, said today that the juror had solicited the bribe....
docs.lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE, Feb. 2 The lawyer for Walter Weikers, accused of trying to bribe a juror in the trial of Gov. Marvin Mandel, said today that the juror had solicited the bribe.
docs.abstract: Weikers lawyer holds juror, Oscar Sislen, had solicited $10,000 bribe; Weikers allegedly offered Sislen bribe to vote for acquittal (S)

headline.main: Defense Lawyer Says Mandel Juror Solicited a Bribe

docs.snippet: ROOTS "A Quaker Reader," a musical tribute to his faith, is Ned Rorem's initial composition since winning the Pulitzer Prize last year and his first large-scale work for solo organ. The 11-movement, 30-minute piece contains sayings by such Quaker ...
docs.lead_paragraph: ROOTS "A Quaker Reader," a musical tribute to his faith, is Ned Rorem's initial composition since winning the Pulitzer Prize last year and his first large-scale work for solo organ. The 11-movement, 30-minute piece contains sayings by such Quaker writers as William Penn and John Greenleaf Whittier. There are pauses. The composer calls them "the silence which for members of the Society of Friends can sometimes explode into light."
